questions.question_text:
You plan to migrate an SAP environment to Azure.
You need to design an Azure network infrastructure to meet the following requirements:
✑ Prevent end users from accessing the database servers.
✑ Isolate the application servers from the database servers.
✑ Ensure that end users can access the SAP systems over the Internet.
✑ Minimize the costs associated to the communications between the application servers and database servers.
Which two actions should you include in the solution? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
A is correct, because segregating application servers and database servers by using different subnets and network security groups is a minimum cost solution.
C is correct, because S2S VPN is over the Internet.
D is not correct, because users cannot access to SAP environment if you just use internal Azure Standard Load Balancer. unless you use external Load Balancer.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have an SAP environment on Azure.
You are designing a training landscape that will be used 10 times a year.
You need to recommend a solution to create the training landscape. The solution must meet the following requirements:
✑ Minimize the effort to build the training landscape.
✑ Minimize costs.
In which order should you recommend the actions be performed for the first training session? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
I am assuming that a training session will change the training environment - i.e - students do hands-on activity that changes data . Under that assumption, we need to take the snapshots and create the custom image before we deliver the first training session.
So, the answer should be:
Build
Snapshot
Custom Image
Deliver Training
Shutdown and Delete the VM

comments.content: The objective is make 10 training sessions for the same TEAM. the question talk about first training session, dont talk about sessions for other team. "the actions be performed for the first training session". Build, deliver, takesnap, customimege, shutdown.

I would not do do that!
During the training someone can mess up the environment then you save that state.

Build
Snapshot
Custom Image
Deliver Training
Shutdown and Delete the VM

With this you have the clean setup.

discussion.content: First build the landscape - it is required to take a snapshot next-- then from snapshot create the custom image ---- which will be reused for future re-use...... after the image ready - you can HO for training to start, when done - shutdown and delete the landscape to save cost....and then later next time we can re-build from the custom image created .

Hi, you mean that the snapshots&images are taken during every training(e.g 20 days)?
I think this question does not ask running cost, but initiating cost. because there is not any requirements to restore landscape.
for "Minimize the effort", we should take images to simplify creating landscape for 10 times a year. for "Minimize costs", we should delete the landscape after a training session.
Even though you want to save the running cost, you should consider stopping the VMs on the night during a training(e.g 20 days) at first.
So, the Ans should be Build, Snapshot,Custom Image,Deliver Training and Delete.
